name: Three Horseshoes Inn

reviews.text: Set in very rural Dorset this small pub run by Suzanna and Guy (who does the food), will give you a really wonderfully warm welcome and with food to die for. We had lunch of Pate, miniature scotch eggs made from perfectly cooked quails eggs as well as Escargot with cepes all to an accompaniment of what must have been triple cooked homemade chips. The beers are Palmers and the IPA is wonderful.
reviews.title: New Years Eve

reviews.text: The evening celebrations were amazing with an incredible 7 course set menu and then later incredibly friendly local people who popped in to greet the new year. Needless to say breakfast was great
reviews.title: A Dorset Delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all an amazing experience - if you are looking for an intimate weekend with great food, great atmosphere and great local walks in the Dorset countryside whatever the weather - you will not do better. Worth seeking out!
reviews.title: Perfect pub in perfect countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three rather senior citizens - my wife and I plus a female friend (and her border collie) arrived at the Three Horeshoes as quivering wrecks after negotiating the almost impassable lanes in and around Powerstock in order to spend a three-day mini-break in Dorset. We were all immediately transformed back into lively, convivial human beings (except the dog) by the warmth and kindness shown to us by Susie and her husband Karl, who are the embodiment of inspired and inspirational innkeeping. Our spotlessly clean and spacious downstairs rooms overlooked spectacular and breathtaking scenery and the pleasure this afforded was more than matched by the excellence of the food and table service at dinner and breakfast each day. Susie was the epitome of kind concern and helpfulness, whilst Karl excelled himself in preparing a variety of menus which would not be out of place in the very best and most expensive city restaurants. All the staff were similarly attentive and made dining there an absolute delight, even Dale the dog being made to feel especially welcome. We cannot praise the Three Horsehoes and its inimitable hosts Susie and Karl too highly and will most certainly be paying a return visit there in the very near future. Terry O'Brien
reviews.title: A great place to stay and rest weary limbs!

reviews.text: We have stayed at this beautifully located pub about 5 times over the past 8 years or so, and seen three different sets of landlords over that time. This is by far the best incarnation so far - Suzy provides the warmest welcome with good natured enthusiasm, she clearly really enjoys her work and genuinely cares that her guests are happy. Her tolerance of our very drunken gushing over the wonderfulness of the pub was quite remarkable! The upstairs room was spacious and very relaxing, with a fantastic bathroom and lovely toiletries provided. We have also stayed in the downstairs rooms which both have stunning views over the beautiful Dorset countryside. Karl's food is absolutely superb - he is a very talented chef indeed, we just hope he doesn't move on anywhere else too soon. Fish in particular is excellent, also the partridge with home made, perfectly seasoned bread sauce and fantastic creamed cabbage with bacon and cobnuts was probably the best game I have ever eaten - and I eat loads of it! The pudding of burnt cream with rhubarb icecream and shortbread was the stuff of dreams. The pub is also perfectly located in a quiet picture book vilage, complete with chiming church clock, rose festooned cottages and rolling hills. We saw a herd of deer on nearby Powerstock common, a true wilderness that we loved even in the horizontal rain that assailed us. Unfortunately the weather was appalling so we couldn't sit on the terrace and look down on the hillside this time, but hopefully next time. Cant wait to return!
reviews.title: Perfect Pub in deepest Dorset

reviews.title: good food and company

reviews.text: The food was varied and well presented, and at reasonable prices, the breakfast was also up to a good standard.
reviews.title: good value for overnight stop

reviews.text: The room I had was spacious and clean with an albeit small en suite, it also had a small flat screen TV and high speed internet.
reviews.title: gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The corridors and stairs could do with a bit of a makeover, but other than that it was fine.
reviews.title: First rate

reviews.text: The staff were friendly and I would not hesitate to stay again
reviews.title: Nice Views, everything else was a disappointment

reviews.text: This place catered brilliantly for a group of tired and hungry divers on the way back South from St Abbs. The food was great, the staff friendly and helpful and we even got to watch the Olympics closing ceremony in the side bar. There is a great choice of evening meals and they were able to cater well for our gluten intolerant friend. Breakfast also had plenty of choice and very generous portions. Rooms are comfy and clean with all the facilities you need. Would thoroughly recommend this place as a stop over on your way North / South, you will be well looked after!
reviews.title: Excellent value, a friendly, warm welcome and great food!

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight for a friends wedding at nearby Bowburn Hall. The accommodation had a lovely old inn attmosphere and very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast next morning was superb. Highly recommend a stay here.
reviews.title: Cheap cheerful and friendly helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed two nights at the Three Horseshoes Inn a couple of weeks ago on our way to Scotland and were very impressed with the level of comfort, the exceptionally low tariff and the superb quality of the food. The Inn is set in open country yet very close to Durham city centre and the motorway. Our room was very comfortable and we would have no hesitation in recommending the Three Houseshoes to any one wishing to stay in the Durham area. Just one word of advice: if you ask for a full breakfast make sure that you're really hungry because the breakfast is enormous and really appetising!
reviews.title: Simply great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed two night at this Inn on our way up north. I have to admit that on approaching the Inn I had wondered what we would find. It's location sit out in the middle of no where, I was soon to realise that this is part of it's charm. Our room, 2 single beds over looking the rear of the building, had wonderful views of the fields. Each morning we woke to see a hurd of cattle roaming.
reviews.title: Peaceful Surroundings

reviews.text: All of the staff did their best to make you feel welcome. The food was beyond belief. On my first night I had the ploughmans. Never, ever, in my life time have I seen such large portions. It puts other restaurants to shame. Our dinning the following night was equal impressive, no one goes away hungry. The breakfast was cooked well and set us up nicely for the day.
reviews.title: A warm welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Three "Shoes" hosted me and my good lady wife last weekend and by the way this is a flamin gem! In fact we were very fortunate too as the weather put pay to a camping adventure and instead brought us here. We loved the room over looking the Egardon Valley and the food , breakfast and a restaurant meal of Rib of Beef was delish! Service great too! Will definitely return, complete value for money. Thanks guys.
reviews.title: The Power of this Places Stock has Gone Up!

reviews.text: Had an evening meal here in the Bar area of the pub. This is NOT ordinary pub food. The food is simply fantastic, an excellent chef, varied menus, all freshly sourced produce. Very relaxed and friiendly service atmosphere. Highly highly recommend visiting here if you are in the area. Although driving to Powerstock does mean negotiating a few little narrow lanes.. its very well worth it. Picturesque location.
reviews.title: Relaxed Meal, Fantastic Food

reviews.text: The pub had a very traditional, friendly feel to it,
reviews.title: Worth Getting Lost For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A word of caution - get a good sat nav and a decent map when you set off for this pub restaurant in the middle of the back of beyond. But, go there !!! The five of us ate some fantastic food. Home made bread, scallops, Veal Burgers, Chicken, Home Made Fish cakes, Triple cooked chips, veal escapoles with home made gnocchi, home made ice cream - all were terrific. What we liked were the twists to each dish - a home grown herb, something forraged from the local area, the unusual combinations of ingredients. The food reassuringly takes some time to arrive but each dish is spot on. Portions are generous, the staff friendly and helpful (especially with the directions home). The place itself is a pub pure and simple; no fancy interior design schemes here. All the effort goes into the food and long may that continue. Excellent.
reviews.title: Superb food, imaginative menu & great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We called in here for dinner early on a Friday evening and had a most memorable meal. The chef tries hard to focus on local and seasonal - even to the extent of garden-grown nettle soup and rhubarb icecream. The menu is very imaginative and the dishes arrive beautifully presented. The dining room is quite small, rustic but comfortable and the service is friendly, well-informed and professional. We did not stay overnight but have already recommended friends and business contacts to stay here to experience some truly wonderful food and hospitality in beautiful countryside.
reviews.title: Beautiful pub with beautiful food in beautiful Dorset

reviews.text: Just returned after three nights at this lovely inn. We stayed in a family room (room 6 - double plus bunk beds) - with our 3 and 4 year olds and were made to feel very welcome. The room was lovely - spacious, bright and very clean. The food was delicious, plentiful and reasonably priced - we ate in the bar/restaurant every evening with the kids. Breakfast was great and my children were delighted at being offered hot chocolate! We didn't want to leave and will be returning next time we are up in Durham. Thank you Sara and Martin!
reviews.title: Lovely family friendly Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the three horseshoes inn for four nights .We were made to feel very welcome
reviews.title: warm welcome

reviews.text: by Sara and Martin. The food was excellent and there was lots to choose from on the menu we both had something different to eat each evening and were spoilt for choice. The room we stayed in was very clean and breakfast was mega we had no need for lunch ! The road outside was very busy but this was not a problem as traffic eased off
reviews.title: Home From Home

reviews.title: Jolly landlord/lady

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hit upon this charming pub by complete accident coming down from Eggardon Hill in the pouring rain.The lanes are really narrow but the sceneray is beautiful, really quiet and rural .We were rather too late for lunch, sadly, but decided to stop for a drink. The inn is a delight, just what you want from an old country inn , lovely old wooden tables and chairs and a delightful and welcoming young lady on the bar. Whilst it is an old inn it is run really well with 21st century customers in mind and lovely tidbits on offer like Dorset chorizo and olives and rather temptingly "fizz" with or without Dorset sour apple liquor!! Will definitely return to try out the food!
reviews.title: Welcoming country inn

reviews.text: We were a party of 6 for Boxing Day lunch. They were able to accomodate us even though we were a very last minute booking. We were given a lovely window table. We had fish and chips and the fish cakes. Fish was cooked to perfection. Fish cakes huge and delicious. Home made tatar sauce was to die for. All absolutely excellent. Would highly recommend a visit if in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent food - highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch out for tomtom's directions. We came from Melton osmond and tomtom's sent us seriously off piste. We ended up on a farm road perched atop a hill. Spectacular views but driving not for the faint hearted.
reviews.title: Dorset At Its Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for lunch on a surprisingly sunny November day. We sat in the sun on the terrace overlooking the very tranquil valley and village. A rare treat to be able to sit out in the winter sun! It was not busy, not surprising as it was mid-week in the winter but for us that was perfect as we were able to kick back and enjoy the terrace to ourselves (there were some guests inside). We had a really great meal. I had calamari with a wicked garlic mayonnaise and sea bream for the main course with twice cooked chips. Totally yummy and didn't need to eat anything else that day! Lovely hostess. Definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Good lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We felt the menu could have been slightly greater. My wife's beer battered cod and chips cooked in dripping (as all fish and chips should be!) was good the triple cooked chips slightly over done the home made tartare sauce excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed char grilled mackeral, crab croquettes, braised fennel, little sweet tomatoes, aioli, sea purslane (small amount of the latter!). Beautifully fresh and well cooked. Rhe rhubarb and apple crumble with vanilla custard we shared was exemplary. I had walked in the night before from our holiday cottage and had a superb welcome from a girl who I thought was a reincarnation of Tess of the D'Urbevilles also some of the locals!
reviews.title: Star rating ? ? ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival received a very warm welcome. However the entrance and steps to rooms does need a lot of upgrading and desperately needs a new carpet. The room was a pleasant surprise after that. Clean and well appointed with a very comfortable bed. Plenty of tea, coffee and water. Fantastic views from the room and from the pub in general. Quite a bit of road noise in the room facing the road, despite the double glazing. Room had a very efficient electric heater though no heating in bathroom. Bathroom clean and well presented but no complimentary toiletries. Also a slight smell from the vent. Tissue box only had one tissue in it though, to be fair, we did not ask for another box. Given how helpful and pleasant the owners were I am sure it would not have been a problem.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: Food was reasonable with a varied menu and well served. Breakfast was super. Good local ales are on offer in bar. Martyn and Sarah are excellent hosts.
reviews.title: Family owned pub, very nice Landlords

reviews.text: I had trepidations about staying above a pub. As and American, I suppose I assumed it would be loud and smoky. I can assure you this could not be further from the truth. The pub and family room that we stayed in were comfortable, neat and tidy. Someone mentioned a hum in the room we stayed in and we noticed that as well. I believe it came from the kitchen which closes down at half nine. In any event, that noise did not deter my children or wife from falling fast asleep. I went downstairs for a few pints and really enjoyed my time with the Landlords and other guests.
reviews.title: Great find.....

reviews.text: Martyn and Sarah were very kind, friendly, and enthusiastic. It is a real shame that privately owned pubs such as this one are closing all over the UK. Hurry, you will miss out if you don't book a room! I overheard a conversation from the Landlord that they have two sittings on Sunday and you need to book ahead or else you will not get in. The food was fab, the local cask ale was tasty, and the atmosphere is laid back.
reviews.title: Fantastic Family Friendly Place to Stay

reviews.text: I will have to admit that the carpet in the stairwell is tatty and the rooms aren't shiny brand new. I am a clean freak and normally am turned off at a tiny bit of dust, but one can easily overlook outdated materials. The family room was basic, but clean, tidy, and comfortable. It seems like you would have a lot of road noise, but it quiets down around 9pm. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great food and lovely atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted to find this small, remote, dog friendly inn, and would not hesitate to visit again. We were made very welcome from the moment we said 'hello' and charmed by Susi who keeps an excellent front of house; meanwhile her partner cooks superbly - while the menu was relatively limited, this allowed him to produce excellent food with some very interesting twists, certainly not your typical pub grub.
reviews.title: Delighted with our overnight stay

reviews.text: We visited the Three Horseshoes on a number of times whilst staying in a nearby cottage, we found the food excellent and the staff were very polite and helpful. the beer garden has lovely views over the surrounding countryside, we would certainly visit this pub again if we visit Dorset again.
reviews.title: Good food and very nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great find a few miles from Bridport, even though the lanes are very narrow The Three Horseshoes Inn, Powerstock more than met our needs, set in great countryside with opportunity to explore and walk locally. Our room, the annexe of the Inn was excellently furnished to a very high spec. with a beautiful view. We had a very warm welcome and the staff were very friendly throughout our visit. Breakfast was more than sufficient and dinner in the evening (x2) was first rate, quality again 5 star for room and food. Would not hesitate to return to repeat the experience.
reviews.title: "Needed a base for three nights"

reviews.text: Went to the Three Horseshoes for Sunday lunch and had a very poor experience. After commenting to waitress that we felt the Greek style salad was extremely small for the £10 price tag we were shocked to be offered more chips or bread instead. Their attitude to our quiet and polite comments were appalling and eventually our meals were taken away and returned with quartered tomatoes slung on top. We were eating in the beer garden at the rear of the pub and felt that they only just tolerated the two small children we had with us Can now understand why the pub was so quiet on a Sunday lunchtime in the middle of the holiday season. Normally we would have had to book for a table here over a year ago. Such a shame.
reviews.title: family sunday lunch!!!! I don't think so!!!

reviews.text: We and another couple have just spent two nights staying at The Three Horseshoes Inn in Dorset, and wow what a fantastic experience. The rooms were truly awesome with fantastic views, large, modern, comfortable and exceptionally clean. The food was top class from start to finish, a delight to eat there. The owners/managers could not be more welcoming and it is also fantastic value for money. Breakfast was also first class and we will definitely be going there again.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic.

description: The shoes’ is a Victorian inn tucked away in a peaceful part of West Dorset. Powerstock is a picturesque village centered on a beautiful Norman church. Dogs are more than welcome in our guest rooms and bar. There are three spacious double en-suite guest rooms. Two have superb views looking out over the valley, with the third ideal to make into a family room. Award winning chefs, a great reputation of excellent cuisine.
